project_desc: This repository houses my implementations of the CoordConv layer as introduced in paper - An intriguing failing of convolutional neural networks and the CoordConv solution by Liu et al.
This Repository Contains code for image captioning. The code uses TensorFlow Hub mobilenet module for image features. These features are given as hidden state input to the LSTM Cells.
This repository houses my implementations of the Neural Arithmetic Logic Unit (NALU) as introduced in paper - Neural Arithmetic Logic Units by Trask et al.
In this repository, I created a capsule network inspired by paper - Dynamic Routing Between Capsules by Sabour et al.
This is an experiment work done to remove Backpropagation and in-turn Gradient Descent and use Particle Swarm Optimization technique for Neural Network Training.
This repository uses VGG-16 or VGG-19 pretrained model to do Neural Style transfer. Completely implemented in TensorFlow.
This application is built by replicating work done in paper - Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification by Kim, Yoon.
This repository contains my implementations for various autoencoders - Unsupervised training of Deep Neural Networks.
What if we make two networks play along? One to fool other and other to not get fooled easily! The two networks are - Generator and Discriminator, collectively called GANs
The jupyter notebook available here showcase my approach to tackle the kaggle problem of Facial Expression Recognition Challenge. Bonus! Try it with webcam.
Word2Vec is an approach to convert words from our raw corpus to vectors in such a manner that each element of vector represents a relationship between the words.
Software Reliability Growth Model (SRGM) is a way to generate a mapping of number of days of a software to its failure frequency. This code uses Simulated Annealing to guess SRGM params.
This repository contains some machine learning algorithms wrote from scratch in Python using NumPy only.
Language modeling using Deep Learning is a way of asking a model to predict which word grammatically (more like logically) comes next. This model is pretty useful in many applications.

There are drawbacks, like requirement of knowing the dynamics of the environment, which we face when using techniques like Value Iteration and Policy iteration. Sampling-based approx. techniques like Q-Learning overcomes it.
Implementation of Policy Iteration, a Reinforcement Learning technique. Rather than going for the optimal policy directly we iteratively increase our current policy of the agent.
Q-value is an exact method of solving a Reinforcement Learning problem. The goal of the task is to find expected utility starting in state s, taking action a, and (thereafter) acting optimally.

Value Iteration is an exact method of solving a Reinforcement Learning problem. The goal of the task is to find how much expected discounted reward we can get from s if we use the best possible policy.
This repository contains a simple recommendation system, made completely from scratch (no external libraries required).
Twitter scrapping can be done in variety of ways. This repository works with one such solution.
